title:
A Selection Theorem for the Carath\'eodory Kernel Convergence of Domains
  in $\mathbb{C}^n$
abstract:
We present a selection theorem for domains in $\mathbb{C}^n$, $n\ge 1$, which
states that any tamed sequence of pointed connected open subsets admits a
subsequence convergent to its own kernel in the sense of Carath\'eodory. Not
only is this analogous to the well-known Blaschke selection theorem for compact
convex sets, but it fits better to the study of normal families of holomorphic
maps with variable domains and ranges. In particular, it applies to the
rescaling method initiated by Pinchuk.
